page.title: 14SOCIAL CONCERNS 2.
page.content: The number of stray dogs in the area is another worrying factor, with the problems they bring - scattering bins and fouling the pavements. The lack of facilities in the urban area have given rise for concern. There is a significant lack of play areas and equipment for young children. Those facilities which were offered have destroyed by vandals and not replaced. It was felt by many people that this area does not provide entertainment suitable to teenagers. Liverpool and other major towns are not easily accessible and are to expensive to visit. Most young people themselves singled out the lack of night life - discos etc. - as the chief problem.
